metadata.title: CVE-2021-20233 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in grub2 in versions prior to 2.06. Setparam_prefix() inthe menu rendering code performs a length calculation on the assumptionthat expressing a quoted single quote will require 3 characters, while itactually requires 4 characters which allows an attacker to corrupt memoryby one byte for each quote in the input. The highest threat from thisvulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity as well as systemavailability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-20233` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

grub-efi-amd64 - 2.06-2ubuntu7
grub-efi-amd64-bin - 2.06-2ubuntu7
grub-efi-arm64 - 2.06-2ubuntu7
grub-efi-arm64-bin - 2.06-2ubuntu7
No subscription required

grub-efi-amd64-signed - 1.180+2.06-2ubuntu7
grub-efi-arm64-signed - 1.180+2.06-2ubuntu7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: grub2-unsigned package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.06-2ubuntu7').
grub2-signed package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.180').
